definition-item.definition-title: SUPPLYING COMBUSTION ENGINES IN GENERAL WITH COMBUSTIBLE MIXTURES OR CONSTITUENTS THEREOF

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatus for supplying fuel, air or non fuel substances to combustion engines, e.g. carburettors for liquid fuel; apparatus for feeding, or treating combustion-air, fuel, or fuel-air mixture; Fuel injection apparatus
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Internal-combustion piston engines; Combustion engines in general

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors
Apparatus for mixing fuel with air, the fuel being brought into mixing contact with the air by lowering the air pressure, e.g. in a venturi
Fuel-injection apparatus

Apparatus for introducing fuel into a space, e.g. engine cylinder, by pressurising the fuel, e.g. by a pump acting behind the fuel, and thus includes the so-called "solid-fuel injection" in which liquid fuel is introduced without any admixture of gas
Low-pressure fuel injection
Fuel injection in which the fuel-air mixture containing fuel thus injected will be substantially compressed in the compression stroke of the engine
Pumping element
A single piston-cylinder unit in a reciprocating-piston fuel-injection pump or the equivalent unit in any other type of fuel-injection pump

definition-item.definition-title: Carburettors with means for facilitating engine's starting or its idling below operational temperatures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

When the engine is cold, fuel vaporizes less readily and tends to condense on the walls of the intake manifold, starving the cylinders of fuel and making the engine difficult to start; thus, a richer mixture is required to start and run the engine until it warms up. To provide the extra fuel, a choke is typically used; this is a device that restricts the flow of air at the entrance to the carburettor, before the venturi. With this restriction in place, extra vacuum is developed in the carburettor venturi, which pulls extra fuel through the main metering system to supplement the fuel being pulled from the idle and off-idle circuits. This provides the rich mixture required to sustain operation at low engine temperatures. In addition, the choke can be connected to a cam or other device which prevents the throttle plate from closing fully while the choke is in operation. This causes the engine to idle at a higher speed. Fast idle serves as a way to help the engine warm up quickly, and give a more stable idle while cold by increasing airflow throughout the intake system which helps to better atomize the cold fuel. In many carburetted cars, the choke is controlled by a cable connected to a pull-knob on the dashboard operated by the driver. In some carburetted cars it is automatically controlled by a thermostat employing a bimetallic spring, which is exposed to engine heat, or to an electric heating element. This heat may be transferred to the choke thermostat via simple convection, via engine coolant, or via air heated by the exhaust. Some carburettors do not have a choke but instead use a mixture enrichment circuit. Typically used on small engines, enricheners work by opening a secondary fuel circuit below the throttle valves. This circuit works exactly like the idle circuit, and when engaged it simply supplies extra fuel when the throttle is closed.
Carburettors are used in all types of engines. Nowadays new inventions mainly take place in the field of small engines. e.g. motorcycles, lawn mowers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors for gaseous fuel
Carburettors combined with low pressure fuel injection

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

Priming

Devices for delivering the correct amount of fuel and air under idling i.e. slow running conditions of the engine.
Low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus, F02M69/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with means for facilitating engine's starting or its idling below operational temperatures

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with means for influencing, e.g. enriching or keeping constant, fuel/air ratio of charge under varying conditions

definition-item.definition-title: Float-controlled apparatus for maintaining a constant fuel level

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

To ensure a ready mixture, the carburettor has a float chamber that contains a quantity of fuel at near-atmospheric pressure, ready for use. This reservoir is constantly replenished with fuel supplied by a fuel pump. The correct fuel level in the bowl is maintained by means of a float controlling an inlet valve When fuel is used up, the float drops, opening the inlet valve and admitting fuel. As the fuel level rises, the float rises and closes the inlet valve. The level of fuel maintained in the float bowl can usually be adjusted by a setscrew.
Carburettors with means for influencing, e.g. enriching or keeping constant, fuel/air ratio of charge under varying conditions, F02M7/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Floatless carburettors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details, component parts, or accessories of carburettors, not provided for in, or of interest apart from, the apparatus of groups F02M1/00 - F02M17/00

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Float
Hollow body floating on fuel level and acting on fuel inlet valve

definition-item.definition-title: Other details, e.g. floats, valves, setting devices or tools

definition-item.definition-title: Carburettors with means for influencing, e.g. enriching or keeping constant, fuel/air ratio of charge under varying conditions (choke valves for starting F02M1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Under all engine operating conditions, the carburettor must measure the airflow of the engine, deliver the correct amount of fuel to keep the air/fuel mixture in the proper range and distribute the two finely and evenly. This job would be simple if air and gasoline were ideal fluids; in practice, however, their deviations from ideal behaviour due to viscosity, fluid drag, inertia, etc. require a great deal of complexity to compensate for exceptionally high or low engine speeds. A carburettor must provide the proper air/fuel mixture across a wide range of ambient temperatures, atmospheric pressures, engine speeds and loads and centrifugal forces, like cold start, hot start, idling, acceleration, high speed at full throttle (high load), slow speed at part throttle (light load).
To function correctly under all these conditions, carburettors contain a complex set of mechanisms to support several different operating modes.
Electrical control of supply of combustible mixture or its constituents, F02D41/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with means for facilitating engine's starting or its idling below operational temperatures
Idling devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with means for influencing, e.g. enriching or keeping constant, fuel/air ratio of charge under varying conditions

definition-item.definition-title: Carburettors having air or fuel-air mixture passage throttling valves other than of butterfly type (register-type carburettors F02M11/00); Carburettors having fuel-air mixing chambers of variable shape or position

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

A carburettor basically consists of an open pipe through which the air passes into the inlet manifold of the engine. The pipe is in the form of a venture, which narrows in section and then widens again, causing the airflow to increase in speed in the narrowest part. Below the venturi is a valve called the throttle valve. This valve controls the flow of air through the carburettor throat and thus the quantity of air/fuel mixture the system will deliver, thereby regulating engine power and speed. The throttle valve is connected through a mechanical linkage of rods and joints to the accelerator pedal.
Controlling engines by throttling air or fuel-and-air induction conduits or exhaust conduits, F02D9/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Register-type carburettors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for supplying engines with non-liquid fuels, e.g. gaseous fuels stored in liquid form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Systems like tanks, vaporizers, pumps and injectors for supplying engines with a non-liquid, mostly gaseous fuel. A gas engine differs from a petrol engine in many ways. The fuel and air are mixed differently. The combustion of a gas/ air mixture is different form a liquid fuel/ air mixture and requires adaptation of the combustion space. Also the energy contents of gas is much lower than that of a liquid fuel. Since (natural) gas is a clean, economical and readily available fuel, many industrial engines are either designed or modified to use gas, as distinguished from gasoline.
Controlling engines characterised by their use of non-liquid fuels, pluralities of fuels, or non-fuel substances added to the combustible mixtures, F02D19/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Engines characterised by operating on gaseous fuels; plants including such engines

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for re-atomising condensed fuel or homogenising fuel-air mixture (combined with secondary-air supply F02M23/12 {; collecting condensed fuel F02M33/02})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Especially when the air is cold the process of vaporisation of fuel into the air is more difficult. Apparatus for re-atomising condensed fuel, e.g. fuel droplets on the inner side of the air intake tube, or homogenising fuel-air mixture, e.g. distribution of fuel and air, help to improve this process.

Arrangements of injectors with respect to engines

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel-injection apparatus carrying the fuel into cylinders by high-pressure gas
Low-pressure fuel-injection
Charging fuel-injection engines

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of fuel-injection apparatus to facilitate the driving of pumps; Arrangements of fuel-injection pumps; Pump drives

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements of fuel-injection pumps including mounting, i.e. fitting or attaching the pumps to the engines.

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus with two or more injectors fed from a common pressure-source sequentially by means of a distributor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel injection apparatus having a driven sequential distributor, combined with or separated from a pump or common pressure source.
Injection pumps for metering and distributing fuel.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Common rail or accumulator injection systems

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: "pump"
"distributor-type pumps".

definition-item.definition-title: the distributor rotating

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Radial pistons carried by the distributor

definition-item.definition-title: {with piston arranged axially to driving shaft (F02M41/123 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Characterised by means for varying fuel delivery or injection timing

definition-item.definition-title: {with piston arranged radially to driving shaft (F02M41/123 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Characterised by means for varying fuel delivery or injection timing

definition-item.definition-title: {Throttling of fuel passages to or from the pumping chamber}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Variably-timed valves controlling fuel passages}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {valves being mechanically or electrically adjustable sleeves slidably mounted on rotary piston}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {valves being fluid-actuated slide-valves, e.g. differential rotary-piston pump}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for metering fuel admitted to pumping chambers, e.g. by shuttles or by throttle-valves}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus operating simultaneously on two or more fuels, or on a liquid fuel and another liquid, e.g. the other liquid being an anti-knock additive

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel injection apparatuses operating simultaneously on two or more fuels or on a liquid fuel and another liquid, the other liquid can e.g. be an antiknock additive, e.g. water.
One of the fuels may be gaseous.
This group does not contain documents describing gaseous fuel injection system. It is limited to constructional aspects of pumps or injectors.
However fuel injection apparatuses operating simultaneously on two or more fuels, one of them being gaseous, also fall under F02M43/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Injection valves for gaseous fuels
Engine-pertinent apparatus for adding non-fuel substances or small quantities of secondary fuel to combustion-air, main fuel, or fuel-air mixture
Engines operating on gaseous fuel
Engines operating on other non-liquid fuels

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus characterised by having a cyclic delivery of specific time/pressure or time/quantity relationship {(pumps having such delivery by means of delivery valves F02M59/462)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Both functional and constructional aspects of injection apparatus. When a pump or injector is specially designed for such injection, then they are classified in these groups.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps having such delivery by means of delivery valves

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel-injectors having such deliveries by means of valves furnished at seated ends with pintle- or plug-shaped extensions
Controlling fuel injection

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: with each cyclic delivery being separated into two or more parts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus with each cyclic delivery being separated into two or more parts or if there is "a continuous cyclic delivery with variable pressure", or
in case "each cyclic delivery" is not "separated into two or more parts", i.e. in case injector doesn't close between parts.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Two or more closing springs acting on injection-valve, and "each cyclic delivery" is NOT "separated into two or more parts"

definition-item.definition-title: with a small initial part {, e.g. initial part for partial load and initial and main part for full load}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Functional and constructional aspects of injection apparatus.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps having such delivery by means of delivery valves
Fuel-injectors having such deliveries by means of valves furnished at seated ends with pintle- or plug-shaped extensions

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Having specially arranged spill port and spill contour on the piston (F02M45/063 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Delivery stroke of piston being divided into two or more parts, e.g. by using specially shaped cams

definition-item.definition-title: {Having more than one injection-valve controlling discharge orifices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatus having more than one injection-valve controlling discharge orifices, even if "each cyclic delivery" is not "separated into two or more parts". Also used if there is "a continuous cyclic delivery with variable pressure".

definition-item.definition-title: providing a continuous {cyclic} delivery with variable pressure

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus providing a continuous cyclic delivery with variable pressure. "Variable pressure" is understood to include "variable flow rate".
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: If "2 or more closing springs are acting on injection-valve", even if, as here, "each cyclic delivery" is not "separated into two or more parts", but is "a continuous cyclic delivery with variable pressure"

If there is "more than one injection valve controlling discharge orifices", even if, as here, "each cyclic delivery" is not "separated into two or more parts", but is "a continuous cyclic delivery with variable pressure"

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus operated cyclically with fuel-injection valves actuated by fluid pressure (fuel- injectors actuated by the pressure in engine working cylinders F02M49/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Injectors only. The needle valves of these injectors are closed by a fluid pressure, with the exception of injectors classified in F02M47/046
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel-injectors actuated by the pressure in engine working cylinders

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel injectors with spring for needle closing and using fluid for assisting the spring force
Solenoid or piezoelectric control valves used in these injectors
Fuel injection valves held closed by a cyclically-operated mechanism for a time and automatically opened by fuel pressure
Low-pressure fuel-injection

definition-item.definition-title: {Mechanically actuated valves draining the chamber to release the closing pressure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydraulically actuated valves draining the chamber to release the closing pressure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Electrically actuated valves draining the chamber to release the closing pressure}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of injection valves
Details of control valves

definition-item.definition-title: using fluid, other than fuel, for injection-valve actuation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Using fluid, other than the fuel taking part of the injection, for injection-valve actuation. Thus it also covers the case where the actuation fluid is actually fuel that is not taking part of the injection or stems from a separate fuel line, i.e. shown in this example:

definition-item.definition-title: Other fuel injectors peculiar thereto

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel injectors not covered by F02M47/02 and F02M47/04.

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus in which injection pumps are driven or injectors are actuated, by the pressure in engine working cylinders, or by impact of engine working piston

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus characterised by being operated electrically

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g.: electrical wirings, pumps with electric plunger drive and injectors with electric needle drive (solenoid, piezoelectric etc.)
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Injectors with electric control valves
Pumps with electric control valves

definition-item.definition-title: specially for low-pressure fuel-injection ({F02M51/005 takes precedence;} pumpsper se F02M51/04; injectors per se F02M51/08)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangement of electrical wires and connections
Fuel injection apparatus characterised by pumps
Low pressure fuel injection apparatus characterised by injectors

definition-item.definition-title: Injectors peculiar thereto {with means directly operating the valve needle}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Injectors peculiar thereto, with electrical means directly or indirectly via a hydraulic or mechanical linkage operating the valve needle.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluid pressure operated valve needles
Injector details not provided for under F02M51/06

definition-item.definition-title: {using piezoelectric or magnetostrictive operating means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Valves in general actuated by piezoelectric means
Piezoelectric devices; Electrostrictive devices; Magnetostrictive devices; Processes or apparatus peculiar to the manufacture or treatment thereof or of parts thereof; Details thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Linkage between operating means and valve member

definition-item.definition-title: {the actuator being hollow, e.g. with needle passing through the hollow space}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Injectors featuring hollow actuators, e.g. the needle passing through the hollow space. Example:

definition-item.definition-title: {using electromagnetic operating means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Valves in general actuated by electromagnetic means

definition-item.definition-title: {having two or more electromagnets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {acting on one mobile armature (F02M51/0628 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {having a stepped armature}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {having a spherically or partly spherically shaped armature, e.g. acting as valve body}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {having a plate-shaped or undulated armature not entering the winding (if entering the winding F02M51/0664)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Armatures entering the winding

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature acting as a valve}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature having a valve attached thereto}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Armatures having a valve attached thereto or integrated therewith.

definition-item.definition-title: {the valve being a short body, e.g. sphere or cube}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the valve being spherical or partly spherical}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the valve being an elongated body, e.g. a needle valve}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the body being hollow and its interior communicating with the fuel flow}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature and the valve being allowed to move relatively to each other or not being attached to each other}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The armature and the valve being allowed to move relatively to each other or not being attached to each other or at least part of valve being flexible.
E.g.:

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature acting as a valve or having a short valve body attached thereto}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group.
In cases where it cannot be easily determined whether the valve body attached to the armature is short or elongated both F02M51/0667 and F02M51/0671 should be used.

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature having an elongated valve body attached thereto}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The armature having an elongated valve body attached thereto, or the armature having an elongated valve body integrated therewith, e.g. the armature constituting in itself an elongated valve body. Eg.:
E.g.:
In cases where it cannot be easily determined whether the valve body attached to the armature is short or elongated both F02M51/0667 and F02M51/0671 should be used.

definition-item.definition-title: {the valve body having cylindrical guiding or metering portions, e.g. with fuel passages}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The valve body having cylindrical guiding or metering portions, e.g. with fuel passages. E.g.:

definition-item.definition-title: {all portions having fuel passages, e.g. flats, grooves, diameter reductions}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: If the passage isn't in the cylindrical guiding or metering portion, but in another part of the valve member, e.g. its central part

definition-item.definition-title: {the body being hollow and its interior communicating with the fuel flow (F02M51/0675 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
In cases where it cannot be easily determined whether the valve body attached to the armature is short or elongated both F02M51/0667 and the appropriate class/code F02M51/0671+ should be used.

definition-item.definition-title: {the armature and the valve being allowed to move relatively to each other or not being attached to each other}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The armature and the valve being allowed to move relatively to each other or not being attached to each other or at least part of valve being flexible.
Example:

definition-item.definition-title: {and permanent magnets (F02M51/0696 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Injectors using electromagnetic operating means and permanent magnets
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel injection apparatus characterised by the use of movable windings

definition-item.definition-title: {as valve or armature return means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the use of movable windings}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus characterised by having heating, cooling or thermally-insulating means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel injection apparatus having heating, cooling or thermally-insulating means, including devices to influence the fuel temperature in injectors or common rails
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with heating, cooling or thermally insulating means
Apparatus for de-liquefying gaseous fuels by heating
Apparatus for heating fuels with low melting point
Adding hot secondary air to fuel-air mixture
Apparatus for thermally treating combustion-air, fuel, or fuel-air mixture

definition-item.definition-title: with fuel-heating means, e.g. for vaporising

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with heating, cooling or thermally insulating means
Apparatus for de-liquefying gaseous fuels by heating
Apparatus for heating fuels with low melting point
Adding hot secondary air to fuel-air mixture
Apparatus for thermally treating combustion-air, fuel, or fuel-air mixture

definition-item.definition-title: Injectors with heating, cooling, or thermally-insulating means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with heating, cooling or thermally insulating means
Apparatus for de-liquefying gaseous fuels by heating
Apparatus for heating fuels with low melting point
Adding hot secondary air to fuel-air mixture
Apparatus for thermally treating combustion-air, fuel, or fuel-air mixture

definition-item.definition-title: with fuel-heating means, e.g. for vaporising

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carburettors with heating, cooling or thermally insulating means
Apparatus for de-liquefying gaseous fuels by heating
Apparatus for heating fuels with low melting point
Adding hot secondary air to fuel-air mixture
Apparatus for thermally treating combustion-air, fuel, or fuel-air mixture

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injection apparatus characterised by their fuel conduits or their venting means; {Arrangements of conduits between fuel tank and pump F02M37/00 (venting in general B01D19/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. fuel conduits between pump and injector, their coupling, constructional aspects of accumulators or common rails.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel feed and filtering systems
Arrangements of conduits between fuel tank and pump and apparatus or systems for feeding liquid fuel from storage containers to carburettors or fuel-injection apparatus
General layout of a common rail system with fuel circuit and valving for control of fuel pressure
Low pressure fuel rails and fuel circuits
Venting in general
Pipes in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Joints; Sealings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sealing of fuel injection apparatus not otherwise provided for
Sealing arrangements between injector and engine, e.g. to avoid leakage of combustion chamber gases to the outside through the space between fuel injector and engine
Sealings in general
Joints in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Venting means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Venting means, i.e. for venting gases.

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangement of fuel passages inside of injectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Specific arrangements or details of fuel passages inside injectors. E.g. or

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injectors combined or associated with other devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Fuel injectors combined or associate with other devices, e.g. injectors combined with fuel pumps, injectors combined with sensors, injectors combined with engine valves, and injectors combined with plugs.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric drive of fuel pumps
Hydraulic drive of reciprocating piston in fuel pumps
Pneumatic drive of reciprocating piston in fuel pumps

definition-item.definition-title: Pumps specially adapted for fuel-injection and not provided for in groups F02M39/00 -F02M57/00 {, e.g. rotary cylinder-block type of pumps}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pumps specially adapted for fuel-injection and not provided for in groups F02M39/00 - F02M57/00. For further subject-matter covered, see the section "Special rules of classification".
The structure of this group comprises:

list-item.paragraph-text: a functional part (groups F02M59/20 - F02M59/42), and
a general part with details, e.g. plunger sealing, valve structure, materials, manufacturing aspects (F02M59/44 - F02M59/485).

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rotary distributor type pumps, dual fluid pumps and electrically driven pumps
General features of pumps

section-body.paragraph-text: Besides the subject-matter covered by the main group title, this place also covers details of the pumps classified in F02M41/00, F02M43/00, F02M51/00.

definition-item.definition-title: with cylinders arranged radially to driving shaft, e.g. in V or star arrangement

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reciprocating piston type pumps with cylinders arranged radially to driving shaft, e.g. in V or star arrangement. "arranged radially" is interpreted to be understood as excluding in-line pumps.

definition-item.definition-title: fuel delivery being controlled by means of fuel-displaced auxiliary pistons, which effect injection {(combined with rotary distributor supporting pump pistons F02M41/1422; low pressure fuel-injection F02M69/12)}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary pistons
Pistons that do not provide pressure intensification but act as metering pistons effecting injection.

definition-item.definition-title: by variably-timed valves controlling fuel passages {to pumping elements or overflow passages}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Overflow passages
any draining passage wherever it is situated, even after (e.g. downstream of) the pump or the delivery valve. Generally, it is the pumping chamber that is drained.

definition-item.definition-title: {Rotary valves}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rotary fuel distributor
Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Valves being actuated electrically}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves

definition-item.definition-title: {Pump inlet valves of the check valve type being open when actuated}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Pump inlet valves being closed when actuated}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: for starting of engines {(supply of excess fuel F02M59/447)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supply of excess fuel

definition-item.definition-title: Valves

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of valves
Valves in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Electrically operated valves, e.g. using electromagnetic or piezoelectric operating means}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solenoid valves that control fuel amount delivered
Valve details

definition-item.definition-title: Fuel-injectors not provided for in groups F02M39/00 - F02M57/00 or F02M67/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Constructional parts (F02M61/02-F02M61/12) and a general, details part (F02M61/16-F02M61/205).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mounting of injectors with respect to engines

definition-item.definition-title: having valves {, e.g. having a plurality of valves in series}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel-injectors not provided for in groups F02M39/00 - F02M57/00 or F02M67/00 having valves, e.g. having a plurality of valves in series.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Valves in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Means for adjusting injection-valve lift}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for adjusting injection-valve lift during operation of the valve, in order to adjust it to the operating conditions and requirements of the moment.

definition-item.definition-title: {Filtering elements specially adapted in fuel inlets to injector}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For fuel feed systems
Edge filtering elements
Filters adapted for location in special places, e.g. in pipe-lines, pumps

definition-item.definition-title: {Assembling; Disassembling; Manufacturing; Adjusting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Assembling; Disassembling; Manufacturing and Adjusting in the sense of calibrating during manufacture.

definition-item.definition-title: Injection nozzles, e.g. having valve seats; {Details of valve member seated ends, not otherwise provided for}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: The valves opening in direction of fuel flow

definition-item.definition-title: {Discharge orifices having different orientations with respect to valve member direction of movement, e.g. orientations being such that fuel jets emerging from discharge orifices collide with each other}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Discharge orifices arranged so that the jets are flowing therethrough at an angle to the normal axis of the injector.

definition-item.definition-title: {Discharge orifices being situated in different transversal planes with respect to valve member direction of movement}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Discharge orifices having changing cross sections, e.g. being divergent}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Discharge orifices having variable cross section, e.g. divergent, convergent or stepwise changing cross section. E.g.:

definition-item.definition-title: {Dimensional characteristics of discharge orifices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. the exact size, diameter is given, or a special relationship between a diameter and a length is given.

definition-item.definition-title: {Means specially adapted for varying the spring tension or assisting the spring force to close the injection-valve, e.g. with damping of valve lift}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel injectors of the accumulator type having a spring whose force assists the hydraulic closing of the injection valve

definition-item.definition-title: Other fuel-injection apparatus having pertinent characteristics not provided for in groups F02M39/00 - F02M57/00 or F02M67/00; Details, component parts, or accessories of fuel-injection apparatus, not provided for in, or of interest apart from, the apparatus of groups F02M39/00 - F02M61/00 or F02M67/00; {Combination of fuel pump with other devices, e.g. lubricating oil pump}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Most active subgroup in this group is F02M63/0225 dealing with the common rails. The groups F02M63/0003 - F02M63/0008 include injection system having a fuel pressure source and an on/off valve in each fuel conduit to injector. These systems are different from accumulator type fuel injectors classified in F02M47/02. Also these valves have different function than the control valves in the fuel injection pumps defined by the groups F02M59/36-F02M59/366.

definition-item.definition-title: {Valves (for fuel metering see the relevant groups, e.g. F02M59/34; inlet or outlet check valves for fuel injection pumps F02M59/46; for fuel injectors see the relevant groups, e.g. F02M61/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Valves other than fuel injection valves, i.e. fuel injectors, whenever relevant.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metering fuel by means of throttling valves in fuel-injection pumps
Metering fuel by means of valves in fuel-injection pumps
Valves used in fuel-injection pumps only and not provided for in F02M39/00 - F02M57/00, e.g. inlet or outlet check valves for fuel-injection pumps
Valves in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Valves in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Not to be used to characterise fuel injection valves, i.e. fuel injectors, unless they have pertinent characteristics or have details, component parts or accessories not provided for in F02M61/00, F02M51/06, or Indexing Codes F02M2200/00.

The valves in F02M63/0012 may be part of fuel injection apparatus for which there exist specific classes elsewhere, and which are thus classified both in that specific class and in F02M63/0012, if the valve has a relevant feature per se.

definition-item.definition-title: {using electromagnetic operating means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electromagnetic valves per se

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electromagnetic valves per se

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the arrangement of electromagnets or fixed armatures}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The fixed armature is the magnetic core that does not move.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Lift valves, i.e. having a valve member that moves perpendicularly to the plane of the valve seat}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Poppet valves, i.e. having a mushroom-shaped valve member that moves perpendicularly to the plane of the valve seat}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {with spherical or partly spherical shaped valve member ends}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Combined valve units, e.g. for controlling pumping chamber and injection valve}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Valve unit controlling more than one function.

definition-item.definition-title: {Pressure relief valves}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Valves that open when a specific pressure has been reached.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pure check valves

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pressure relief valves in general

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: " pressure limiting valve", "pressure safety valves" and "overpressure safety valves"

definition-item.definition-title: {Check valves (F02M59/462, F02M59/464 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fuel pump delivery valves
Fuel pump inlet valves of the check valve type
Pressure relief valves

table-column.paragraph-text: Check valves in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Throttling valves, e.g. having variable opening positions throttling the flow}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Varying fuel delivery of a fuel pump in quantity or timing by throttling of passages to pumping elements or of overflow passages

definition-item.definition-title: {for cutting-out pumps or injectors in case of abnormal operation of the engine or the injection apparatus, e.g. over-speed, break-down of fuel pumps or injectors (safety devices acting on engine fuel system on lubricant pressure failure F01M1/24); for cutting-out pumps for stopping the engine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices acting on engine fuel system upon lubricant pressure failure

definition-item.definition-title: {Fuel-injection apparatus having a common rail feeding several injectors (F02M63/0003 takes precedence); Means for varying pressure in common rails; Pumps feeding common rails}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Constructional details of common rails

definition-item.definition-title: Testing fuel-injection apparatus, e.g. testing injection timing {(testing of ignition F02P17/00; measuring fuel consumption G01F9/00); Cleaning of fuel-injection apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Testing of fuel injection apparatus.
Testing injection timing.
Measuring injector spray angle
Quality check of fuel-injection apparatus.
Monitoring the function of the fuel injection apparatus in situ, e.g. for monitoring injection timing or injection quantity, or malfunction detection.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing of ignition
Measuring fuel consumption

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cleaning hollow articles by methods or apparatus specially adapted thereto
Safety or indicating devices for abnormal conditions

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus in which fuel-injection is effected by means of high-pressure gas, the gas carrying the fuel into working cylinders of the engine, e.g. air-injection type (using compressed air for low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus F02M69/08)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Using compressed air for low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus:
Control aspects of fuel injection by means of high-pressure gas:

section-body.paragraph-text: These groups relate mostly to old technology, however there are some recent inventions. These groups can overlap with the group F02M69/08. The classification can be made in both groups.

definition-item.definition-title: Low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus {; Apparatus with both continuous and intermittent injection; Apparatus injecting different types of fuel}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Low pressure fuel injection apparatuses including such apparatus with both continuous and intermittent injection, and apparatus injecting different types of fuel. Low pressure fuel injection normally means gasoline fuel injection. However in the recent years with common rail technology development the gap between diesel fuel injection and gasoline fuel injection has become very narrow. Therefore, it is more practical to classify the details of gasoline fuel injection apparatus just in the groups F02M41/00-F02M63/00. In specific cases and the injection of fuel in the air inlet manifold, the inventions are classified in the subgroups of F02M69/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of gasoline fuel injection apparatus
Electrically-operated
High pressure gasoline common rail fuel injection systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Low pressure fuel injection apparatuses means normally gasoline fuel injection. However in the recent years with common rail technology development the gap between diesel fuel injection and gasoline fuel injection has become very narrow. Therefore, it is more practical to classify the details of gasoline fuel injection apparatus just in the groups F02M41/00-F02M63/00. In specific cases and the injection of fuel in the air inlet manifold, the inventions are classified in the subgroups of F02M69/00.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Low pressure fuel injection

fuel injection in which the fuel-air mixture containing fuel thus injected will be substantially compressed in the compression stroke of the engine. Traditionally, the concept of "low-pressure" fuel-injection is associated with spark ignition engines, where the mixture is compressed.
High-pressure fuel-injection
fuel-injection being associated with compression ignition engines, where fuel is injected after compression of the air.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by means for intermittently metering the portion of fuel injected (F02M69/12, F02M69/14 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus comprising a fuel-displaced free-piston for intermittently metering and supplying fuel to injection nozzles
Low-pressure fuel-injection apparatus having cyclically-operated valves connecting injection nozzles to a source of fuel

definition-item.definition-title: {for injecting into the combustion chamber (F02M69/046 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The injection nozzle opening into the engine cylinder for direct injection, i.e. in-cylinder injection.

definition-item.definition-title: {for injecting into both the combustion chamber and the intake conduit}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
One injector injecting fuel in the intake plus one injector injecting directly into the combustion chamber.

definition-item.definition-title: comprising a fuel-displaced free-piston for intermittently metering and supplying fuel to injection nozzles {(high-pressure fuel-injection with fuel-displaced auxiliary pistons F02M59/32)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: High-pressure fuel-injection with fuel-displaced auxiliary pistons

definition-item.definition-title: having cyclically-operated valves connecting injection nozzles to a source of fuel under pressure during the injection period {(high-pressure fuel injection apparatus F02M63/0003)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: High-pressure fuel injection apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {the valves being actuated electrically (electrically-operated injectors F02M51/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electrically-operated injectors

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by means for facilitating the starting-up or idling of engines or by means for enriching fuel charge, e.g. below operational temperatures or upon high power demand of engines
